name: dishonorable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A dishonorable action causes embarrassment and a loss of people's respect: This was a dishonorable attempt to avoid responsibility. They regard killing an unarmed man as dishonorable.
A dishonorable person is not honest or fair, or does not deserve praise and respect: I know him, and he is not a dishonorable man. See
dishonor
More examplesFewer examplesThe whole dishonorable episode was covered up by the government. To cheat like that is deeply dishonorable behavior.His opponents called the ad "dishonest and dishonorable."He would never do anything mean or dishonorable.They are corrupt, dishonorable, and untrustworthy.
